Articles.Content:
I have been trying to launch plains in to orbit with out cheating the game. My Kerbals in there aircraft don't seem to have the best bang for there buck I can get up to 20,000 to 25,000 loose all balls no power loss too heavy of a craft or not enough fuel/oxidizer, power to weight ratio is great in one instance and the orbital rockets wont do the job, not  enough power in another case, am I missing something I cant seem to launch a X-plain since 1.0?  and I am not using any mods at all.

Edited May 10, 2016 by wfirebaugh

1 hour ago, wfirebaugh said:

I have been trying to launch plains in to orbit with out cheating the game. My Kerbals in there aircraft don't seem to have the best bang for there buck I can get up to 20,000 to 25,000 loose all balls no power loss too heavy of a craft or not enough fuel/oxidizer, power to weight ratio is great in one instance and the orbital rockets wont do the job, not  enough power in another case, am I missing something I cant seem to launch a X-plain since 1.0?  and I am not using any mods at all.

Your question is a little short on details, pictures, craft files etc.  But it appears you are capable of building stable and controllable aircraft, so it's a good start.

There's many ways to make a space plane.   But here's the key stats to my latest

https://kerbalx.com/AeroGav/Astrojet-Citation

 

Loaded Weight  30T

Empty Weight 15T

Fuel Weight 15T

Airbreathing Engine  - one Whiplash

Closed Cycle Engine - 2 NERV  - 800ISP, 60 KN thrust each

Frontal area -  3 mark one fuselage's  -  the main one with crew cabins, whiplash etc,  the  two sponsons either side with the nuke engines

Other rubbish hanging off the outside (minimise!)  - 3 vernier lifting engines, 3 undercarraige legs, 1 retractable solar array, one pair of Fuel Ducts

Lift rating - 25

Performance - 5 kerbals and docking port to low orbit with 2200 DV to spare

Some screenshots might help.

Otherwise, the general tips apply: MORE BOOSTER
